str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
Barabbas. Of Chaldee origin; son of Abba; Bar-abbas, an Israelite.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

word: to have Jesus put to death.
parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
